title: More of Your Savory Foods Could Do With a Honey Finish
description: When it comes to sweeteners, I like sugar (unless we are talking soda, in which case I like aspartame in Diet Coke and Diet Dr. Pepper only). Something about growing up in the “health” food-obsessed 90s put me off alternative sweeteners, especially honey, but only in sweet applications. I do not like it in baked goods…

title: How to Use Up, Repurpose, or Sell Leftover Renovation Materials
description:
Renovating your home is exciting, expensive, and stressful. You might think the difficulty is over once the last coat of paint has dried, but there’s almost always one final step: Dealing with the leftover construction materials.

title: How to Make a Last-Minute Presentation Deck
description: A digital slideshow presentation can be a beautiful, informative thing—if you know what you’re doing and how to use your software to the best of its abilities. title: How to Get Through Customs and Immigration As Fast As Possible
description: If you’re like most people, the thought of dealing with customs and immigration at the airport can be stressful—but it doesn’t have to be as dreadful as it’s often made out to be. The next time you travel abroad and need to fly back into the U.S., here’s how to get through immigration more seamlessly.

title: How Often Should I Get a New Smartphone?
The Best New Widgets for Your iPhone Lock Screen

title: How to Master 'Baby Talk' (and Why You Should)
description: Many of us instinctually know that talking consistently to a baby or toddler is important for their development. title: The Items Every Backpack Needs, Ranked by Usefulness
description: Back-to-school season means backpacks are on the brain. I believe having a stocked backpack is an adult thing to do, too, though. Rarely do I leave the house with nothing but my phone, wallet, and keys. I’d rather be prepared with more than the bare minimum when I’m out and about.

title: Make a Breakfast Burrito With Last Night's Fried Rice
